Transcript: Eve: So, why'd you want to come to Jake's?
Ian: Oh, I like it here. It's the first place I ever held you in my arms.
Eve: Oh -- yeah, you mean when I fell into them.
Ian: That's right. A few of those kamikazes in you, didn't you?
Eve: Yeah. You're the one that made me walk the plank.
Ian: Is that right? I don't remember that.

Eve: Really. Admit it, Thornhart -- you got me drunk, and you made me dance 
on the bar.
Ian: No, I was an innocent bystander. I liked what I saw. Very sexy.
Eve: How about when I dragged you on to the dance floor?
Ian: You looked sexy there, too.
Eve: No, I mean, what were you thinking?
Ian: I was thinking how much I was falling in love with you.
Eve: I remember I was trying so hard to hide those feelings.

Eve: Thank God. No more hiding our feelings.
Abe: No, they can't take my blood! I'll kill you! I'll kill you all!
Lucy: Doc, what is going on?
Abe: I'll kill you all!
Chris: Jack's dead? You expect me to believe that?

Sam: Believe what you want, but Jamal ran him over a cliff at the bike race. 
He killed him.
Chris: I don't buy it.
Sam: It's true. They probably got rid of your brother's body by the border.

Chris: You know what? Shut up. Just shut your mouth and tell me, what kind of 
sick game are you playing here?
Alison: Look, Livvie doesn't know what happened to Zach.
Jamal: Maybe she saw something. If I just talk to her for a minute, maybe --
Alison: No, no. I think we should leave her alone.
Jamal: Look, we got to try to figure out what happened.
Alison: Can't you just give her a minute, please?
Jamal: Look, I wish we had a minute to give her, but we don't. You know that.

Alison: Livvie? Can we ask you a few more questions about what happened 
tonight?
Livvie: Yeah, sure.

Jamal: All right, Livvie, we know you had nothing to do with Zach's death, 
ok, but did you see anybody? Was there, like, anybody hanging around or 
anything?

Livvie: No. I -- I didn't see anyone. I just -- I heard a noise. There might 
have been someone there.

Alison: And that's how you got away -- because Zach was distracted by the

Livvie: Yeah, whoever it was saved me from being hurt.
Jamal: So, do you have any idea who it could have been?

Livvie: No. I mean, maybe it's the person who's been following me around. I

Eve: Whoa, whoa, whoa. So after witnessing my fabulous bartending skills last

Eve: Back home. Isn't it great to be home? Oh, Karen looks fantastic, doesn't

Ian: No. He didn't.
Eve: He didn't say anything?
Ian: We didn't discuss it.
Eve: You guys -- you -- why don't men ever discuss their feelings?

Ian: Men do. We -- no, we would. We would talk about them if the women that

Eve: Ok. Yeah, I'm sorry. Go ahead.
Ian: Um, I didn't mean that like --

Eve: I think I'm going to be sick.

Kevin: Ok.

Kevin: All right.

Sam: I'm not playing any games. You're the one who wanted to know the truth.

Sam: You obviously don't talk to your brother very much, do you?
Chris: What's that supposed to mean?
Sam: Jack and Jamal had a big falling-out.
Chris: Over what?

Sam: Jack was putting the moves on Alison. Jamal saw and went ballistic. You

Chris: Not nuts enough to kill someone.
Sam: Ok. You don't believe me? When's the last time anyone saw Jack?
Chris: The bike race. Jack rode for Jamal because Jamal never showed.

Sam: Yeah, well, you should check your information because Jamal did show up

he went after him. Ask around. Everyone saw Jamal tear out of there.
Chris: Really? And did you and your friend actually see Jamal take Jack out?

Sam: It's why Zach's dead. It's why I'm afraid they're going to come after

Chris: Who's they? Jamal and Alison?

Sam: You knew she'd cover for that guy. Besides, she was just as pissed at

Chris: What about Livvie? I mean, she still hangs around with those two. I

Sam: Jack worked her, big time. A girl doesn't forget that. She doesn't just

Kevin: What?
Livvie: Look, he was just here right before you guys came.
Alison: Do you see anything?
Alison: Jamal?
Alison: Jamal? Jamal? Oh.
Jamal: I didn't see anyone.
Alison: Look, Livvie, do you know why this guy is following you?
Livvie: I don't know.
Jamal: So you think it might be that guy in the alley.

Alison: I don't like that you keep running into this guy.
Livvie: Look, it -- it's probably nothing.

Ian: Ok. All right, here we go.
Ian: This is only the beginning.

Kevin: That's the most ridiculous accusation I ever heard. Now, why would you

Sam: Because I saw it happen. Jamal ran Jack off the road.

Kevin: I don't know why you're making something like that up, but Jack isn't

Kevin: He left town after he got caught stealing from the bike shop.
Chris: Why couldn't my private investigator find him?
Kevin: Gee, I don't know. Maybe he doesn't want to be found.
Chris: No, if Jack's around, my guy would find him.
Kevin: I just told you, he's not around, he left town.
Chris: Did you see him leave, or did Livvie and her friends tell you this?
Kevin: Oh, I'm not having that conversation with you.
Chris: Oh, then you didn't see him leave.

Kevin: I'll tell you what -- I'll humor you, Chris. I'll talk to Livvie, and

Chris: Sure, like you're going to interrogate your own daughter.
Kevin: What are you doing?
Chris: I'm getting the cops involved.
Sam: Don't forget Zach. They killed him to cover Jack's death.

Kevin: Look, I know about this girl. She had a thing for Jack. She has her

Chris: Why don't we let the cops figure out who's lying?
Kevin: Because I don't want these kids' lives ruined by a bogus accusation.
Chris: Hey, my brother could be dead! So back off and give me the phone.

Kevin: You treated your brother like dirt. Now all of a sudden you're

Chris: I don't have to explain myself to you. Worry about your own family.
Kevin: Look, Chris, you know Livvie.

Caleb: Soon. I'll have my Olivia back.

Livvie: Yeah. Pretending that Jack's alive.

Ian: Do you want to marry me?

Kevin: Andy, don't do this.

Victor: Sleeping, finally.

Michael: No, Caleb. You're staying here with me.

Jamal: So what are you saying, she's dreaming up this guy in her head?
